`Markdown` uses `Latex` syntax to type math.

- To type math in markdown, try: $y=x+1$ or $$y=x+1$$

- subscript and superscript: $x_1$, $x^1$

- multiplication and division: $x \times y$, $\frac{y}{x}$ 

Now some (slightly) more complicated examples:

$$\sum_{i=1}^{N}t_{i}=T$$
$$\max_{t_{i}}[pt_{i}q-ct_{i}]$$
$$t_{i}^{*}=\frac{a-\frac{c}{p}-bT^{2}}{2bT}$$
$$N(\frac{a-\frac{c}{p}-bT^{2}}{2bT}) = T$$
$$T^{*}=\sqrt{\frac{a-\frac{c}{p}}{(1+\frac{2}{N})b}}$$
